intro: Erigeron blanchetii, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are linear and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow with white ray florets. Erigeron blanchetii is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
